page.title: 08 Houses at Weaverthorpe
page.content: Apart from the{6 outlying farms,}all {87 houses}are grouped in the village, on either side of the road running approximately east to west, along the stream, the Gypsy Race. As the {local stone is chalk}the oldest houses are only about 200 years old, with the chalk faced with brick in most cases, or else in pebble-dash. The usual roofing material is { {Yorkshire pan tiles}with some slate. Most rows of terraced cottages have been pulled down and brick houses built in their place. Since the{34 {council houses}were built in about 1948, 10 houses have been built, 4 of them bungalows. 15 houses have been extensively altered, 4 others are empty and 2 are holiday cottages. 5 houses are for sale: from Â£17000 for a 2 bedroom terraced cottage to Â£45000 for a 3 bedroom detached house.
